revised_title: Heterogeneous Catalysis at Line Defects: Clean-Off Reactions and Displacement Reactions
tldr: The article discusses the ability of domain boundaries in adsorbed layers to act as effective catalysts in heterogeneous catalysis. It analyzes clean-off reactions and displacement reactions, explaining how the rate and reaction kinetics are controlled by the total perimeter of the boundaries. The authors provide theoretical analysis and compare it with experimental data available.
